item.title: Version 0.4.0
item.description:
• Fix code coloring not working for some languages
  • Add support for code coloring with dark themes
  • Fix file extensions being override to `.markdown`
  • Allow any text file to be opened
  • Fix code blocks showing up twice in HTML
  • Command-Shift-Return to insert a newline above
  • Command-Return to insert a newline before

Code coloring is greatly improved in this release. It’s still pretty inaccurate. I’ll work on improving that in future releases.

item.title: Version 0.3.8
item.description:
• Fix random dots appearing under text
  • Fix full screen
  • Disable dash correction for now
  • ⌘K will prefill your clipboard if it contains a link
  • Fix window not remembering its position
  • Basic horizontal rule parsing
  • Horizontal rules show up in outline
  • Fix scroll bars on dark themes
  • Fix dragging files onto the dock icon to open them
  • Fix bug with deleting a single character

item.title: Version 0.3.7
item.description:
• Enable code coloring by default
  • Change default save extension to .markdown
  • Status bar now changes color with themes properly
  • Fix changing between Solarized Dark and Solarized Light themes
  • Fix smart quotes inside of links and images
  • Allow opening .apib files
  • Improve undo
  • Improve indenting and unidenting

item.title: Version 0.3.6
item.description:
• New preview split pane
  • Improve status bar calculations and speed
  • Improve reliability when deleting backwards
  • Improve text selection colors
  • ⌘K to insert a link. This is still needs some work, but it’s a start.
  • ⌘-click to toggle task completion
  • ⌘J to toggle inline code. (Definitely open to suggestions for a better keyboard shortcut.)

The keyboard shortcut for toggling the outline is now ⌘⌥O. You can toggle the new preview pane with ⌘⌥P.

This update has a lot of technical changes. The Mac app portion (actually relatively small since most of the code is in shared frameworks so it can work on iOS) has been rewritten in Swift. Whiskey now uses storyboards on the Mac as well. This is a huge improvement because using view controllers and auto layout becomes a lot easier. Hopefully this will fix any weirdness with blank windows.

Support for more languages is coming (hopefully) in the next update. The emoji fix has been remove since the multi-language will fix that indirectly. I’ve been delaying sending this out for a bit since I had hoped to get that in this one, but it’s taking awhile and wanted to go ahead and send this out.

item.title: Version 0.3.5
item.description:
• Improve theme colors
  • Style selection. It still needs work, but it’s an improvement.
  • Improve insertion point color

item.title: Version 0.3.4
item.description:
• Fix Fireball theme
  • First draft of HTML preview

Better HTML preview is definitely coming. Hacked this first draft together pretty quick. It will definitely be a pane in the main window instead of its own window. I’m trying to figure out how themes will work. Right now, it just uses whatever theme you have selected for typing. Please send any ideas on how you want this to work to sam@nothingmagical.com. Thanks everyone!

item.title: Version 0.3.3
item.description:
• Improved link parsing
  • Improved theme system
  • New theme from Tim Van Damme
  • Fix document icon
  • Improved sidebar behavior and colors
  • Improved status bar colors

Whiskey now uses Sparkle for updates so you can conveniently click “Install and Relaunch.” Sandboxing had to be disabled to make Sparkle work. The App Store version will definitely be sandboxed.

I’ve also added some analytics to help with development. Only two events are tracked: launches and opening a document. No other information is collected. The content of a document isn’t recorded and never leaves your computer.

Thanks for helping test Whiskey. Send any feedback to sam@nothingmagical.com.

item.title: Version 0.3.2
item.description:
• Improved window positioning
  • Don’t prompt to save for a blank document
  • Fix code highlighting

item.title: Version 0.3.1
item.description:
• Support txt and text files
  • Correctly count characters
  • Fix markdown getting parsed inside code
  • Theme support with several new themes!
  • Fancy new blurry sidebar with a better design
  • Animated neat/rocks switch

This version now requires Yosemite.

item.title: Version 0.3
item.description:
• Emoji support 😎
  • Disable resizing preferences window
  • Allow the window to get narrower
  • Fix bug with == headers at the beginning of a document.
  • Don’t spell check code or URLs
  • Move spell checking preference from menu bar to preferences window
  • Prevent trying to open URLs that don’t have an app to handle them

Thanks so much for all of your feedback. Keep it coming!

item.title: Version 0.2.4
item.description:
• Fix bold italic
  • Markdown parser improvements
  • Other improvements

item.title: Version 0.2.3
item.description:
• Added maximum width for text to improve full screen experience
  • Removed buggy word-wrap preference
  • Improved & handling when exporting to HTML
  • Markdown parser improvements

item.title: Version 0.2.2
item.description:
• Improve syntax highlighting
  • Improve whiskey command line tool
  • Fix document icon. You may need to rebuild your LaunchServices database to see it.

item.title: Version 0.2.1
item.description:
• Fix for “invisible text”
  • Fix for default preferences not being applied correctly

item.title: Version 0.2
item.description:
• Initial support for code coloring inside of fenced code blocks
  • Improve automatic smart quotes
  • Lots of performance improvements

item.title: Version 0.1.17
item.description:
• Indent list items that wrap
  • Toggle tasks with Command-Return. You can make tasks like this: - [ ] Call mom

item.title: Version 0.1.16
item.description:
• Improved undo support for keyboard shortcuts like bold, italic, etc.
  • RTF export support. Currently, this doesn’t handle high UTF-8 characters correctly.

item.title: Version 0.1.15
item.description:
• Greatly improved list support
  • Improved HTML export
  • More compliance with Gruber’s test suite
  • Fix links in span-level elements
  • Fix issues with span-level false matches
  • “Copy HTML” will copy the whole document if there is no selection.
  • Added “Copy HTML” keyboard shortcut: Command-Shift-C
  • New status bar design

item.title: Version 0.1.14
item.description:
• Improve code block parsing
  • Improve HTML export

This release was all work on MarkdownKit, the engine that powers Whiskey. I’m going through a standard set of test files. So far 2 of 22 are passing. Next, I’ll be focusing on lists.

item.title: Version 0.1.13
item.description:
• File > Export > HTML menu item
  • Add “Copy HTML” contextual menu item
  • Fix smart list items, block quotes, and code blocks

This is the first release with HTML export! The HTML is still a work in progress. Lists are the worst right now. I’m working to match character for character the reference implementations (Gruber and Redcarpet).

Smart list items still trigger if you are on the blank line after them. This will get fixed when the parser can understand plain line breaks from trailing new lines.

item.title: Version 0.1.12
item.description:
• New document icon
  • Parse link titles
  • Improved cursor position
  • Improved realtime coloring
  • Status bar (Press ⌘/ to toggle) with smart word count
  • Fancy about window

The word count counts actual words and ignores Markdown syntax. If you’re curious, read more.

This release removes code coloring inside code blocks. My previous approach isn’t going to work. I’m considering either writing something from scratch or removing the feature for 1.0.

I also had to remove the menu item to install the command line tool. You can simply symlink it from inside Whiskey’s bundle to where ever you want.

item.title: Version 0.1.11
item.description:
• Command line launcher. Choose “Install Command Line Tool” from the Whiskey menu to install it or symlink the binary in `Whiskey.app/Contents/Shared Support/whiskey`.
  • Started on preferences design
  • Undo and redo for menu actions
  • Add strikethrough menu action
  • Add link to Markdown guide in Help menu
  • Added preference for code coloring. (Off by default since it’s still super buggy.)
  • Add fenced code block support.
  • Improved underlined headers parsing.
  • Improved support for multiline code blocks.
  • Improved disabling smart quotes and smart dashes in code blocks.
  • Add preference to disable varying size headers

item.title: Version 0.1.10
item.description:
• Continuous preview for font size preference
  • Menu items (and keyboard shortcuts) for toggling bold, italic, underline, and highlight.
  • Improved selecting multiple lines and indenting or unindenting. (Unindenting still needs a little work.)

item.title: Version 0.1.9
item.description:
• Icon! Trying toggling the neat or on the rocks preference.
  • Fix highlights at the beginning of paragraphs.

item.title: Version 0.1.8
item.description:
• Fixed scrolling issues caused by word wrap. (Word wrap is still a little buggy.)
  • Pressing return in a list, code block, or block quote automatically adds the delimiter on the next line. Pressing twice, removes the previous completion.

The cursor sometimes is too far to the left on new lines. Still working on that.

item.title: Version 0.1.7
item.description:
• New outline view for headers. Press ⌘⇧O to toggle. Click an item in the outline to jump to it.
  • Added word wrap toggle
  • Added preference to use tabs instead of spaces
  • Improved navigation when using spaces instead of tabs
  • Added indent and unindent. Press ⌘[ and ⌘].
  • Improved full screen support
  • Smart quotes and smart dashes are now disabled inside code blocks only
  • Fixed automatic updater

item.title: Version 0.1.5
item.description:
• New window design
  • ⌘-click links and images to open

item.title: Version 0.1.4
item.description:
• Sandboxing and Developer ID
  • New automatic updater
  • Improve header coloring
  • Disable smart quotes for now
  • Document icon
  • Register to open Markdown files

item.title: Version 0.1.3
item.description:
• Smart new lines
  • 4 spaces instead of tabs
  • Fix `code`
  • Block-level parser improvements

item.title: Version 0.1.2
item.description:
What's new:

  • Greatly improved parser (that's actually a parser now)
  • Added support for underlined headers
  • Added unordered list support
  • Added support for images

This is the first version that uses a real parser instead of regular expressions. Internally it generates a tree representation of the text that will be useful for interactive editing and converting to other formats later.

item.title: Version 0.1.1
item.description: Added font preferences.

item.title: Version 0.1
item.description: Initial alpha release.
